info.name: Cochlear nerve
info.description: The cochlear nerve is AKA the auditory nerve. This portion of the eighth cranial nerve enters the brainstem at the cerebellopontine angle along with the vestibular nerve. It carries information from the hair cell receptors in the organ of Corti of the cochlear duct of the inner ear to the cochlear nuclei located at the pons/medulla junction. The term vestibulocochlear nerve refers to the entire eighth cranial nerve -- both vestibular and auditory components.
